intro: Heterotrichum atriplicifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its dark green, densely packed foliage and elongated, narrow leaves that often have a distinct midrib. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, including capsules, are borne on short, erect stems called setae. Heterotrichum atriplicifolium plays an important role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its native habitats.
